definitions.definition: To make a loud, hollow , resonant sound.
examples: Thunder boomed in the distance and lightning flashes lit up the horizon.
The cannon boomed , recoiled, and spewed a heavy smoke cloud.
Beneath the cliff, the sea was booming on the rocks.
I can hear the organ slowly booming from the chapel.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , figuratively , of speech ) To exclaim with force, to shout, to thunder.
Of a Eurasian bittern , to make its deep, resonant territorial vocalisation .

examples: Men in grey robes slowly boom the drums of death.

definitions.definition: ( aviation ) To subject to a sonic boom .
( slang , US , obsolete ) To publicly praise , to rally behind .
To rush with violence and noise , as a ship under a press of sail , before a free wind .
( computer chess , slang ) To rapidly adjust the evaluation of a position away from zero , indicating a likely win or loss .
( intransitive ) To flourish , grow , or progress .
examples: The population boomed in recent years.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , dated ) To cause to advance rapidly in price.
examples: to boom railroad or mining shares

definitions.definition: ( dated ) To move quickly , often while making a booming sound.
examples: The train boomed off from the station.

main_definition: To make a loud, hollow , resonant sound.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , figuratively , of speech ) To exclaim with force, to shout, to thunder.
Of a Eurasian bittern , to make its deep, resonant territorial vocalisation .
( aviation ) To subject to a sonic boom .
( slang , US , obsolete ) To publicly praise , to rally behind .
To rush with violence and noise , as a ship under a press of sail , before a free wind .
( computer chess , slang ) To rapidly adjust the evaluation of a position away from zero , indicating a likely win or loss .
( intransitive ) To flourish , grow , or progress .
( transitive , dated ) To cause to advance rapidly in price.
( dated ) To move quickly , often while making a booming sound.

definitions.definition: To extend, or push, with a boom or pole.
To raise or lower with a crane boom.

main_definition: To extend, or push, with a boom or pole.
secondary_definitions: ( usually with "up" or "down" ) To raise or lower with a crane boom.
